solution_line_template: The number of cats on the street is {cat_fraction}*{total_animals} = <<{cat_fraction}*{total_animals}={num_cats}>>{num_cats}
If there are {total_animals} animals on the street, and {num_cats} are cats, there are {total_animals}-{num_cats} = <<{total_animals}-{num_cats}={num_dogs}>>{num_dogs} dogs.
Since a dog has four legs, the total number of legs the {num_dogs} dogs have is {num_dogs}*{legs_per_dog} = <<{num_dogs}*{legs_per_dog}={total_dog_legs}>>{total_dog_legs} legs.
